result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel S. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**0 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: Eau Claire County case 18CF1137.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel S. Brown

records.addlTxt: Amended restitution in the amount of $3,582.16 to include 5% and 10% restitution surcharges.

Amended Restitution Ordered in the amount of $3,750.91
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Amended Restitution Ordered

Restitution Ordered in the amount of $3,582.16
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Restitution Ordered

(3:00 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Samuel S. Brown appeared by video, in custody in the Dodge Correctional Institution. Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Samuel S. Brown.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance. 
State advises victim C.C. is present in court and would like to make a statement.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Domestic Misdemeanor Battery as Repeater, Count 3: Domestic Criminal Damage to Property as Repeater and Count 4: Domestic Disorderly Conduct as Repeater.
Prior offenses acknowledged for Repeater enhancers.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2, Count 3 and Count 4.
Victim C.C. makes a statement.
Parties make statements to the Court regarding the joint sentencing recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 2 years consecutive to Eau Claire County case 18CF1137 with the following conditions:
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone. No contact with the victim C.C. without prior approval by the probation agent and victim C.C. Restitution in the amount of $3,582.16 plus 5% and 10% surcharges. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 0 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
C.A.C.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 04/29/2022 at 3:00 p.m.

written by C.C.

2:05 PM Defendant Samuel S. Brown appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Carly June Sebion for Samuel S. Brown appeared by video, Attorney Loralee Clark for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily and with the advice of counsel. Court accepts waiver. 
Case referred to Br. 5 for scheduling an arraignment.
